data.question: What is the purpose of tuning a layer to a pillared-layer metal–organic framework?
data.answer: The purpose is for adsorption and separation of light hydrocarbons.

data.question: What method was used to record Powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD) analyses?
data.answer: PXRD analyses were recorded on a Rigaku Dmax2500 diffractometer with Cu Kα radiation.

data.question: What is the yield of [Zn3L2(DMPU)2] (FIR-6) based on H3L?
data.answer: The yield of FIR-6 based on H3L is 70%.

data.question: What is the Langmuir surface area of FIR-7?
data.answer: The Langmuir surface area of FIR-7 is 1894.1 m2 g-1.

data.question: What is the maximum uptake capacity of C3H8 by FIR-7a-ht at 298 K?
data.answer: The maximum uptake capacity of C3H8 by FIR-7a-ht at 298 K is 7.24 mmol g-1.

data.question: What is the selectivity of C3H8/CH4 for FIR-7a-ht?
data.answer: The selectivity of C3H8/CH4 for FIR-7a-ht is 78.8.

data.question: What is the role of the bpp ligands in the structure of FIR-7?
data.answer: The bpp ligands occupy two axial coordination sites of the trinuclear [Zn3(COO)6] unit and link adjacent layers to form a pillared-layer framework.

data.question: How does the presence of DMPU molecules affect the structure of FIR-6?
data.answer: The DMPU molecule acts as a dangling ligand to bind one Zn center, controlling the dimensionality of the framework.

data.question: Why does FIR-7 exhibit high C3H8 uptake capacity?
data.answer: FIR-7 exhibits high C3H8 uptake capacity due to its permanent porosity and large Langmuir surface area.

data.question: What is the effect of removing guest molecules on the structure of FIR-7?
data.answer: The removal of guest molecules results in a slight change in the peak positions in the PXRD pattern of FIR-7, indicating a slight change in the host framework.

data.question: How does the topology of FIR-7 contribute to its functionality in hydrocarbon separation?
data.answer: The topology of FIR-7, being a (3,8)-connected network, contributes to its functionality by providing a pillared-layer framework with open channels for effective hydrocarbon separation.

data.question: What is the significance of the trinuclear [Zn3(COO)6] unit in FIR-7?
data.answer: The trinuclear [Zn3(COO)6] unit in FIR-7 is significant for forming the double-layer structure and for being linked by bpp ligands to create the pillared-layer framework.

data.question: Is the synthesis of FIR-6 and FIR-7 carried out under autogenous pressure?
data.answer: True

data.question: Does FIR-7 have a higher Langmuir surface area than FIR-6?
data.answer: True

data.question: Is the yield of FIR-7 higher than that of FIR-6?
data.answer: False

data.question: Does FIR-7 exhibit type-I sorption behaviour for N2 at 77 K?
data.answer: True

data.question: Is the C3H8/CH4 selectivity of FIR-7a-ht lower than 50?
data.answer: False

data.question: Are the thermal stability studies of the materials carried out under a nitrogen atmosphere?
data.answer: False

data.question: Does the synthesis of FIR-6 involve heating the mixture at 120 °C for 48 hours?
data.answer: True

data.question: Is the adsorption capacity of FIR-7 for C3H8 lower at 273 K than at 298 K?
data.answer: True
